findings.title: Minting of unlimited number of sundae tokens
findings.description: The mint function allows minting an unlimited number of tokens without any restriction.

findings.title: Unprotected function calls
findings.description: The functions sendValue, functionCall, functionCallWithValue, and functionDelegateCall are unprotected and can be called by anyone.

findings.title: Insecure approve and transfer functions
findings.description: The approve and transfer functions are insecure due to potential reentrancy issues.

findings.title: Unsecured owner functionality
findings.description: The active smart contract owner has elevated privileges and can execute transfer of contract ownership to a specified wallet or a dead address without restrictions.

findings.title: Unprotected token recovery
findings.description: The recoverERC20 function allows an attacker to recover tokens without any restrictions.

findings.title: Insecure minting and burning of tokens
findings.description: The contract allows insecure minting and burning of tokens due to improper access control on _mint and _finishMinting functions.

findings.title: Unprotected allowance and transferFrom functions
findings.description: The allowance and transferFrom functions are unprotected, allowing unauthorized access and potential token theft.

findings.title: Insecure increaseAllowance and decreaseAllowance functions
findings.description: The increaseAllowance and decreaseAllowance functions are insecure.
